- Europe to South America West Coast UP 2%

created_at: I've been wondering why $ZIM stock price keeps sinking and sinking despite all fundamentals being strong and a healthy outlook for high yield dividends. One potential explanation is the "subsidiary" status of ZIM under Kenon Holdings Ltd. (KEN - NYSE holds about 20-25% of ZIM's stock
column3: down from 29% in January 2022). ZIM's historic earnings prompted KEN to sell off millions in shares at the peak and then declare a major dividend for its shareholders on ZIM's results. Another major shareholder DANAOS did the same thing. This flooded the market and the shorts moved in. I can't calculate the net effect but it appears it's all been negative. https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/KEN/community/
